text:
Sorry to say that they porridge actually failed badly.
Liver overcooked, porridge tasteless.
Only good thing is the you tiao they re fried so it taste better.
Definitely not worth a try.

I had a really unpleasant experience at this porridge stall recently. What happened was after I ordered my food, I asked the elderly man who was preparing the porridge how much it would cost. He didn’t respond, so I asked again, this time a bit louder, thinking he hadn’t heard me. To my surprise, he responded in a loud, rude and sarcastic manner, “Hey miss! I am cooking! can you wait!”

His tone was uncalled for and left me feeling uncomfortable and unwelcome. While the food might have been decent, the way I was treated completely ruined my experience. It’s unfortunate because good service can really make a difference, but I won’t be returning due to the rude behavior I’ve encountered.
Ordered the pork porridge. Consistency was ok. Taste was ok according to my girl. But no you tiao was given and I had asked them to check. No youtiao.

Order was taken by a man in front of the stall and conveyed to the female cook in the stall. She was glued to her phone on social media for a good 30 seconds to a minute  before she put down her phone. And she then asked order to be repeated.
Terrible attitude.

The worst gong bao frog i ever had. Not joking! So many black stains in the dish, how to eat? Acan see from my photos.. somemore they mentioned “must try”.. i ordered 3 frogs costing me $30, so exp.. the frog overcooked and the taste so so only.. frankly speaking, my advice to you all is dont even think of trying on this.
